data_types.name: tosca.datatypes.Root
data_types.description: This is the default (root) TOSCA Root Type definition that all complex TOSCA Data Types derive from.

data_types.name: tosca.datatypes.Credential
data_types.description: The Credential type is a complex TOSCA data Type used when describing authorization credentials used to access network accessible resources.

properties.name: token
properties.description: The required token used as a credential for authorization or access to a networked resource.

properties.name: keys
properties.description: The optional list of protocol-specific keys or assertions.

properties.name: user
properties.description: The optional user (name or ID) used for non-token based credentials.

data_types.name: tosca.datatypes.TimeInterval
data_types.description: The TimeInterval type is a complex TOSCA data Type used when describing a period of time using the YAML ISO 8601 format to declare the start and end times.

data_types.name: tosca.datatypes.network.NetworkInfo
data_types.description: The Network type is a complex TOSCA data type used to describe logical network information.

properties.name: network_name
properties.description: The name of the logical network. e.g., public, private, admin. etc.

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: The unique ID of for the network generated by the network provider.

properties.name: addresses
properties.description: The list of IP addresses assigned from the underlying network.

data_types.name: tosca.datatypes.network.PortInfo
data_types.description: The PortInfo type is a complex TOSCA data type used to describe network port information.

properties.name: port_id
properties.description: The unique ID for the network port generated by the network provider.

properties.name: network_id
properties.description: The unique ID for the network.

properties.name: mac_address
properties.description: The unique media access control address (MAC address) assigned to the port.

properties.name: addresses
properties.description: The list of IP address(es) assigned to the port.

data_types.name: tosca.datatypes.network.PortSpec
data_types.description: The PortSpec type is a complex TOSCA data Type used when describing port specifications for a network connection.

properties.name: protocol
properties.description: The required protocol used on the port.

properties.name: source_range
properties.description: The optional range for source port.

properties.name: target_range
properties.description: The optional range for target port.

data_types.name: tosca.datatypes.xml
data_types.description: The xml type is a TOSCA data Type used to define a string that containst data in the Extensible Markup Language (XML) format.

data_types.name: tosca.datatypes.json
data_types.description: The json type is a TOSCA data Type used to define a string that containst data in the JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format.

data_types.name: tosca.datatypes.network.PortDef
data_types.description: The PortDef type is a TOSCA data Type used to define a network port.

nodeattributes.name: tosca_id
nodeattributes.description: A unique identifier of the realized instance of a Node Template that derives from any TOSCA normative type.

nodeattributes.name: tosca_name
nodeattributes.description: This attribute reflects the name of the Node Template as defined in the TOSCA service template. This name is not unique to the realized instance model of corresponding deployed application as each template in the model can result in one or more instances (e.g., scaled) when orchestrated to a provider environment.

nodeattributes.name: state
nodeattributes.description: The state of the node instance.
